definition: to have a long-cherished wish realized

sentences.english: The arginine transporter makes this possible.
sentences.chinese: 精氨酸載體使這一夙願成爲可能。

sentences.english: Hence, it is a long-cherished wish for me to be a university teacher.
sentences.chinese: 因此，當一名大學教師是我的夙願。

sentences.english: It has been a long-cherished wish for the Chinese people to realize modernization.
sentences.chinese: 實現現代化是中國人民夢寐以求的夙願。

sentences.english: The long-cherished wish of Chinese is pursuing high and higher-yielding of rice.
sentences.chinese: 追求水稻高產再高產一直是中國人的夙願。

sentences.english: Go back to come my long-cherished wish.
She finally achieved her ambition to become an MP.
sentences.chinese: 她終於實現了自己當下院議員的夙願。

sentences.english: I am living on the earth, and my long-cherished wish must be realized.
sentences.chinese: 我活着，我的深懷已久的夙願是一定要實現的。

sentences.english: It has long been a dream of mine to retire and live by the sea.
sentences.chinese: 退休後去海邊生活是我的夙願。

sentences.english: The partnership has fallen far short of its goal to create the world's top-selling TV maker.
sentences.chinese: 他們的合夥未能實現成爲世界暢銷TV製造商的夙願。

definition: to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
